page.title: 07Animals and Birds
page.content:
The area supports many birds, including herons, goldfinches, blackbirds, robins, gulls, magpies, wrens, thrushes and (particularly) sparrows. Although fields are heavily sprayed, there are many trees and hedgerows left largely alone by the farmers, and these provide homes for the birds and also a smaller number of animals, including rabbits, stoats, squirrels and hedgehogs.
The farmers encourage pheasants, mainly for so-called "sport" (shooting) and many of the villagers shoot for fun or for the table, though probably only occasionally.
The area supports a few domesticated animals, including goats, horses and a few cattle. Most families have dogs.
